TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit RelationalOptionsExtension extends System.Object implements class Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Infrastructure.IDbContextOptionsExtension
Public MustInherit Class RelationalOptionsExtension Implements IDbContextOptionsExtension

summary.para: Represents options managed by the relational database providers. These options are set using .
Instances of this class are designed to be immutable. To change an option, call one of the 'With...' methods to obtain a new instance with the option changed.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a new set of options with everything set to default values.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Infrastructure.RelationalOptionsExtension copyFrom) cil managed

Docs.param: The instance that is being cloned.
Docs.summary: Called by a derived class constructor when implementing the method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool ApplyServices(class Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection services) cil managed
Public MustOverride Function ApplyServices (services As IServiceCollection) As Boolean

Docs.param: The collection to add services to.
Docs.summary: Adds the services required to make the selected options work. This is used when there is no external and EF is maintaining its own service provider internally. This allows database providers (and other extensions) to register their required services when EF is creating an service provider.
Docs.returns: True if a database provider and was registered; false otherwise.

Docs.summary: Override this method in a derived class to ensure that any clone created is also of that class.
Docs.returns: A clone of this instance, which can be modified before being returned as immutable.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Infrastructure.RelationalOptionsExtension Extract(class Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Infrastructure.IDbContextOptions options) cil managed
Public Shared Function Extract (options As IDbContextOptions) As RelationalOptionsExtension

Docs.param: The context options to look in.
Docs.summary: Finds an existing registered on the given options or throws if none has been registered. This is typically used to find some relational configuration when it is known that a relational provider is being used.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int64 GetServiceProviderHashCode() cil managed
Public Overridable Function GetServiceProviderHashCode () As Long
abstract member GetServiceProviderHashCode : unit -> int64 override this.GetServiceProviderHashCode : unit -> int64

Docs.summary: Returns a hash code created from any options that would cause a new to be needed. Most extensions do not have any such options and should return zero.
Docs.returns: A hash over options that require a new service provider when changed.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property UseRelationalNulls As Boolean
public: virtual property bool UseRelationalNulls { bool get(); };
public: virtual property bool UseRelationalNulls { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Indicates whether or not to use relational database semantics when comparing null values. By default, Entity Framework will use C# semantics for null values, and generate SQL to compensate for differences in how the database handles nulls.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Validate(class Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Infrastructure.IDbContextOptions options) cil managed
Public Overridable Sub Validate (options As IDbContextOptions)
abstract member Validate : Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Infrastructure.IDbContextOptions -> unit override this.Validate : Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Infrastructure.IDbContextOptions -> unit

Docs.summary: Gives the extension a chance to validate that all options in the extension are valid. Most extensions do not have invalid combinations and so this will be a no-op. If options are invalid, then an exception should be thrown.
